data.query: Summarize the key deliverables in the Woodgrove Bank RFP response from Contoso
data.ground_truth: The proposal includes cloud migration services, 24/7 support, implementation timeline of 6 months, and training for 500 users.
data.context: RFP Response Document: Contoso proposes cloud migration services for Woodgrove Bank including infrastructure assessment, migration execution, 24/7 support services, 6-month implementation timeline, and comprehensive training program for 500 end users.

data.query: What are the payment terms proposed by Contoso?
data.ground_truth: Net 30 payment terms with milestone-based billing: 30% upfront, 40% at midpoint, 30% upon completion.
data.context: Payment Terms Section: Contoso proposes Net 30 days payment terms. Billing structure: 30% upon contract signing, 40% at project midpoint milestone, 30% upon successful completion and acceptance.

data.query: What are the main delivery risks identified in the RFP?
data.ground_truth: Key risks include third-party API dependencies, Q4 resource constraints, and lack of penalty enforcement for delays under 30 days.
data.context: Risk Assessment: Timeline risks include dependency on third-party API integration completion. Resource risks during Q4 holiday season. Contract gap: No penalty clause for delays under 30 days duration.

data.query: Is the Contoso proposal GDPR compliant?
data.ground_truth: Partial compliance - EU data storage and DPA included, but missing explicit right to erasure process documentation.
data.context: Compliance Section: Data stored in EU West region. Data Processing Agreement included in Appendix C. Data retention policy: 7 years. Note: No explicit documentation of Article 17 right to erasure workflow.

data.query: What SLA commitments are proposed?
data.ground_truth: 99.9% uptime SLA with service credits for breaches: 10% credit for 99.5-99.9%, 25% credit below 99.5%.
data.context: Service Level Agreement: Contoso commits to 99.9% monthly uptime. Service credits: 10% monthly fee credit for uptime between 99.5%-99.9%, 25% credit for uptime below 99.5%.

data.query: What is the proposed project timeline?
data.ground_truth: 6-month implementation with 4 phases: Discovery (4 weeks), Design (6 weeks), Migration (12 weeks), Stabilization (4 weeks).
data.context: Project Timeline: Total duration 6 months. Phase 1 Discovery: 4 weeks. Phase 2 Solution Design: 6 weeks. Phase 3 Migration Execution: 12 weeks. Phase 4 Stabilization and Handover: 4 weeks.

data.query: What security certifications does Contoso have?
data.ground_truth: ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, and PCI DSS Level 1 certifications.
data.context: Security Credentials: Contoso maintains ISO 27001:2022 certification, SOC 2 Type II attestation (annual), and PCI DSS Level 1 compliance for payment processing environments.

data.query: Are there any liability caps in the proposal?
data.ground_truth: Liability capped at 12 months of fees paid, excluding gross negligence and willful misconduct.
data.context: Limitation of Liability: Total aggregate liability limited to fees paid in the 12 months preceding the claim. Exclusions: Cap does not apply to gross negligence, willful misconduct, or IP indemnification claims.

data.query: What termination rights are included?
data.ground_truth: Either party can terminate with 90 days notice. Immediate termination for material breach with 30-day cure period.
data.context: Termination Clause: Either party may terminate for convenience with 90 days written notice. Termination for cause: Immediate upon material breach if not cured within 30 days of written notice.

data.query: What data handling obligations are specified?
data.ground_truth: Data encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3). Annual penetration testing. Data deletion within 30 days of contract termination.
data.context: Data Security: All data encrypted using AES-256 at rest and TLS 1.3 in transit. Annual third-party penetration testing required. Upon termination, all customer data deleted within 30 calendar days with certification provided.

data.query: What dispute resolution mechanism is proposed?
data.ground_truth: Escalation to executives within 10 days, then binding arbitration under ICC rules in New York.
data.context: Dispute Resolution: Disputes first escalated to executive sponsors within 10 business days. If unresolved, binding arbitration under ICC Rules. Arbitration seat: New York, NY. Language: English.

data.query: Compare the pricing against market rates
data.ground_truth: Total contract value of $2.4M is within 10% of market average for similar scope cloud migration projects.
data.context: Pricing Summary: Total contract value $2,400,000 over 6-month implementation plus 12-month support. Breakdown: Professional services $1.8M, Software licenses $400K, Support services $200K.

data.query: What training is included in the proposal?
data.ground_truth: 40 hours of instructor-led training for 500 users, plus e-learning portal access for 12 months.
data.context: Training Program: 40 hours instructor-led training sessions for up to 500 end users. Includes role-based curriculum for admins and power users. E-learning portal access provided for 12 months post-implementation.

data.query: Are there any intellectual property concerns?
data.ground_truth: Customer retains IP for configurations and customizations. Contoso retains IP for pre-existing tools and methodologies.
data.context: Intellectual Property: Customer owns all IP rights to custom configurations, integrations, and documentation created specifically for this engagement. Contoso retains ownership of pre-existing tools, accelerators, and methodologies.

data.query: What is the governance structure proposed?
data.ground_truth: Steering committee meets monthly, project team meets weekly, with dedicated project manager and technical lead.
data.context: Governance Model: Executive steering committee monthly meetings. Project management team weekly status meetings. Dedicated resources: 1 Project Manager, 1 Technical Lead, rotating specialist consultants.

data.query: What insurance coverage does Contoso maintain?
data.ground_truth: Professional liability $5M, cyber liability $10M, general liability $2M per occurrence.
data.context: Insurance Requirements: Contoso maintains Professional Liability (E&O) coverage of $5,000,000. Cyber Liability coverage of $10,000,000. Commercial General Liability of $2,000,000 per occurrence, $4,000,000 aggregate.

data.query: What are the acceptance criteria for project milestones?
data.ground_truth: Written acceptance within 10 business days, deemed accepted if no response. Defects must be reported within 5 days.
data.context: Acceptance Criteria: Customer must provide written acceptance or rejection within 10 business days of milestone completion. Silence constitutes acceptance. Any defects must be documented and reported within 5 business days for remediation.

data.query: Does the proposal include change management provisions?
data.ground_truth: Yes, formal change request process with impact assessment required. Changes over $50K need steering committee approval.
data.context: Change Management: All scope changes require written change request with impact assessment. Changes under $50,000 approved by project managers. Changes over $50,000 require steering committee approval. Timeline impacts documented separately.

data.query: What are the force majeure provisions?
data.ground_truth: Standard force majeure clause covering natural disasters, war, government actions. 30-day suspension allowed, then either party can terminate.
data.context: Force Majeure: Neither party liable for delays due to natural disasters, acts of war, terrorism, government actions, or pandemic. Affected party must notify within 5 days. Obligations suspended up to 30 days; if longer, either party may terminate without penalty.

data.query: What audit rights are included?
data.ground_truth: Customer can audit annually with 30 days notice. Contoso provides SOC 2 reports quarterly.
data.context: Audit Rights: Customer may conduct or commission annual audits with 30 days written notice during normal business hours. Contoso will provide SOC 2 Type II reports quarterly. Audit findings requiring remediation addressed within 60 days.
